summary: The 'Cybersecurity in Agriculture Act of 2025' aims to bolster cybersecurity in the agricultural sector. It directs the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a program for Regional Agriculture Cybersecurity Centers. These centers will conduct research, develop technologies, provide training, and build testbeds to improve cybersecurity for seed, horticulture, animal agriculture, and the supply chain. The bill authorizes $25 million per year from 2026 to 2030 for this program. It intends to strengthen security, privacy, and skill workforce.
